Tag 1: First Fix Pressure Test

Tag 1: Second Fix Pressure Test

Tag 1: Sprinkler seismic hanging systems to be installed to AS1170.4 & include engineers sign off & supporting documentation

Name: Fire pen. sealed in accordance with manufact. tested system with location indicated
Tag 1: Fire penetrations to be sealed in accordance with manufacturers tested system with the location indicated on as builts with labels - Please attach photos

Name: Sprinkler head spacings & temperature ratings checked to comply with AS2118
Tag 1: Sprinkler head spacings & temperature ratings checked to comply with AS2118

Name: Review inspection details above to verify all inspections satisfactory
Tag 1: Review inspection details above to verify that all inspections are satisfactory and test procedures can now follows. Ensure TFP chargehand carries out/supervises the pressure testing and remains with the TFP pressure test pump while tests are in progress. Do not allow TFP apprentices to carry out pressure testing without close supervision.

Name: Prior to using TFP mobile air compressor, ensure preset 400kpa pressure relief valve fitted to pipework being tested
Tag 1: Prior to using TFP mobile air compressor, ensure that the pre set 400kpa pressure relief valve has been fitted to the pipe work being tested as a fail safe of over pressurisation. Visually inspect the TFP air compressor being used for the test to ensure no damage to the compressor assembly and hoses. Check to ensure pressure gauge fitted to TFP test manifold is operational. Note, any air testing above 80kpa requires test plan approved by LL regional EHS manager.

Name: Install TFP's certified pressure gauge with test certificate valid & in date to system/area of pipework
Tag 1: Install TFP's certified pressure gauge with test certificate that is valid and in date to the system/area of pipe work being tested

Name: Ensure TFP's air compressor test pump discharge/outlet connector connected to pipework to be tested
Tag 1: Ensure TFP's air compressor test pump discharge/outlet connector is connected to the pipe work to be tested above/down stream of the main stop valve either using roll grove, gal mal screwed or high-pressure hoses.

Name: Once all inspection/checks completed & TFP’s mobile air compressor test pump connected, ensure pre action system main stop valve closed
Tag 1: Once all inspection/checks have been completed and TFP’s mobile air compressor test pump is connected, ensure pre action system main stop valve is closed, turn air compressor on and prove air is available. Open air compressor discharge/outlet valve and fill system to 100kpa, then close discharge/outlet valve. Visually walk the area under test to check for any air leaks.

Name: If no obvious air leaks/pressure holding at 100kpa for 20 minutes, open discharge/outlet valve on TFP's mobile air compressor test pump
Tag 1: If no obvious air leaks and pressure holding at 100kpa for a period of 20 minutes, open discharge/outlet valve on TFP's mobile air compressor test pump and pressurise to 300kpa or 1 and a 1/2 times system working pressure. Check area under test for any air leaks then hold required pressure for two hours. A TFP employee is to remain watching the testing for the entire duration.

Name: After test completion ensure main stop valve is padlocked closed
Tag 1: After test completion ensure main stop valve is padlocked closed. Slowly reduce air pressure to 0 through the pre action system drain valve. Once pressure gauge is reading 0, disconnect TFP’s air compressor test pump from the pre action system and connect systems permanent air compressor ready for system simulation test.

Name: Confirm pre action system solenoid operates on fire alarm in protected area
Tag 1: Confirm pre action system solenoid operates on fire alarm in the protected area when smoked detector is forced into alarm with test smoke.

Name: Ensuring main stop valve still in the closed position
Tag 1: Ensuring the main stop valve is still in the closed position, re-pressurise the dry pipe pre action system with air utilising the permanent systems air compressor to its pre set systems working pressure of 200kpa of air. Then close systems down stream test valve above pre action valve set to prevent system being flooded with water. Open the main stop valve below pre action valve so system is primed and in its normal operational setting. Introduce smoke to simulate smoke detectors going into alarm and operating solenoid. Simulate a loss of air pressure through the pre action valve set drain valve, actuating the pre action system to operate and come into alarm.

Name: Ensure TFP chargehand supervising pressure test at all times & inspects pipework while it is under test pressure
Tag 1: Ensure TFP chargehand is supervising the pressure test at all times and inspects pipework while it is under test pressure. Arrange for client to witness the two-hour pressure test.

Name: Works completed to spec./drawings
Tag 1: Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
